response.answer_text: Mark is def Protestant Christian (maybe evangelical/non-denominational) His dad is a pastor, he's played guitar at church, he’s thanked God at awards shows, he prays before scary movies and meals, he wasn’t allowed to believe in Santa, and he’s quoted the Bible. He said in 2018 that he had never celebrated Halloween as well. Yet he curses the most and has a dirty mind🤣 Johnny is prob Protestant Christian, he auditioned with a hymn. But he’s private about it. There’s plenty of Korean churches in the US. Joon Lee has a video called “5 signs you grew up a Christian” and he said that almost every single Korean/Korean-American he met growing up went to church at some point in their lives. They start going for community reasons, but then they actually become religious. It’s possible he went to some Korean church in the US. Doyoung is supposedly Christian as well. He sang in a choir. He might not be religious as Mark though. Haechan is Christian?? I know he got a Bible from Mark but has he confirmed it?? He also sang in a church choir. Someone let me know, Hyuck might be the same as Doyoung in that he doesn't really go to services/be super religious like Mark. Yuta has an altar in his home in Japan (I think Buddhist) Japanese people do have home altars and go to shrines/temples but it’s more of a cultural, not religious belief. There are some people in Japan who are very religious, but generally speaking, Japanese people aren’t that religious. He also said that he wants to be a woman in his next life, so I think he believes in reincarnation. Ten is def Buddhist. He was a monk for a little bit (a mandatory law in Thailand) and he can't eat beef. (Thai Buddhists borrowed the practice from Hinduism) Jeno grew up Catholic but I think he doesn’t practice anymore. I’m not so sure about the others.
